title: Case Study: Infectious Diseases
text: shown impact Infectious Disease DALYs. Data IHME Healthdata website contains information 200 locations affected infectious diseases 1980 2021. values estimated DALYs average value per 100 000 population country 37 infectious diseases. map_data("world") data used show transformation spatial information expressed long lat simple feature object. layer added showing missing countries considered dataset.
code: library(hmsidwR) data(idDALY_map_data) library(tidyverse) library(sf) world_map <- map_data("world") %>%   filter(!region == "Antarctica") %>%   st_as_sf(     coords = c("long", "lat"),     crs = 4326,     agr = "constant"   ) %>%   st_cast("POINT") %>%   group_by(group) %>%   summarise(     geometry = st_combine(geometry),     do_union = F   ) %>%   st_cast("POLYGON") world_map %>%   ggplot() +   geom_sf() +   geom_sf(     data = idDALY_map_data,     aes(fill = DALYs)   ) +   labs(     title = "Infectious Diseases World Map",     caption = "Average DALYs per country 1990-2021\nDataSource: IHME Data & ggplot2::map_data"   ) +   scale_fill_viridis_c() +   ggthemes::theme_map() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5),     plot.caption = element_text(hjust = 0.5)   )

title: Welcome to hmsidwR!
text: package provides set data used Health Metrics Spread Infectious Diseases Machine Learning Applications Spatial Modeling Analysis book.

title: Welcome to hmsidwR!
code: hmsidwR::sdi90_19 |>   head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   location  year value #>   <chr>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 Global    1990 0.511 #> 2 Global    1991 0.516 #> 3 Global    1992 0.521 #> 4 Global    1993 0.525 #> 5 Global    1994 0.529 #> 6 Global    1995 0.534 hmsidwR::deaths2019 |>   head() #> # A tibble: 6 × 7 #>   location sex    age   cause                           dx upper  lower #>   <chr>    <chr>  <ord> <chr>                        <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 UK       male   <1    Lower respiratory infections 39.7  51.0  29.5   #> 2 UK       female <1    Lower respiratory infections 30.0  38.0  22.6   #> 3 UK       both   <1    Lower respiratory infections 69.7  88.3  53.3   #> 4 UK       male   <1    Stroke                        1.33  2.41  0.850 #> 5 UK       female <1    Stroke                        1.04  1.84  0.669 #> 6 UK       both   <1    Stroke                        2.38  4.21  1.55

title: Welcome to hmsidwR!
code: library(tidyverse) id <- hmsidwR::id_affected_countries %>%   ggplot(aes(     x = year,     group = location_name   )) +   geom_line(aes(y = YLLs),     linewidth = 0.2,     color = "grey"   ) +   geom_line(     data = id_affected_countries %>%       filter(location_name %in% c(         "Lesotho",         "Eswatini",         "Malawi",         "Central African Republic",         "Zambia"       )),     aes(y = YLLs, color = location_name)   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "none") +   labs(     title = "Countries with highest AVG YLLs",     subtitle = "due to infectious diseases from 1990 to 2021",     caption = "DataSource: IHME GBD Results for infectious diseases deaths and YLLs 1980 to 1999",     x = "Year", y = "DALYs"   ) # add a plotly version library(plotly) plotly::ggplotly(id)

what: Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases
title: Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases
text: goal hmsidwR provide set data used Health Metrics Spread Infectious Diseases Machine Learning Applications Spatial Modeling Analysis book.

title: Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases
text: can install development version hmsidwR GitHub :

title: Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(hmsidwR) library(dplyr) data(sdi90_19) head(subset(sdi90_19, location == "Global")) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   location  year value #>   <chr>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 Global    1990 0.511 #> 2 Global    1991 0.516 #> 3 Global    1992 0.521 #> 4 Global    1993 0.525 #> 5 Global    1994 0.529 #> 6 Global    1995 0.534 sdi_avg <- sdi90_19 |>   group_by(location) |>   reframe(sdi_avg = round(mean(value), 3))  head(sdi_avg) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   location       sdi_avg #>   <chr>            <dbl> #> 1 Aceh             0.58  #> 2 Acre             0.465 #> 3 Afghanistan      0.238 #> 4 Aguascalientes   0.606 #> 5 Aichi            0.846 #> 6 Akita            0.792 sdi90_19 |>   filter(location %in% c("Global", "Italy", "France", "Germany")) |>   group_by(location) |>   reframe(sdi_avg = round(mean(value), 3)) |>   head() #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   location sdi_avg #>   <chr>      <dbl> #> 1 France     0.79  #> 2 Germany    0.863 #> 3 Global     0.58  #> 4 Italy      0.763

what: hmsidwR: Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases — hmsidwR-package
title: hmsidwR: Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases — hmsidwR-package
text: collection data functions used Health Metrics Spread Infectious Diseases book. book provides tools calculating DALYs (YLLs+YLDs), important health metrics. also shows R code modeling infectious diseases machine learning. Finally, allows user understand visualize results making maps. Gazzelloni (2024) doi:10.5281/zenodo.10818338 .

title: hmsidwR: Health Metrics and the Spread of Infectious Diseases — hmsidwR-package
text: Maintainer: Federica Gazzelloni fede.gazzelloni@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: Kriging Best Fit: kbfit - Fit variogram models and kriging models to spatial data and select the best model based on the metrics values — kbfit
Kriging Best Fit: kbfit - Fit variogram models and kriging models to spatial data and select the best model based on the metrics values — kbfit
text: response character string specifying response variable formula formula object specifying model fit: response ~ predictors data simple feature object containing variables formula models list characters vector specifying variogram models fit initial_values list named numeric vectors specifying initial values variogram models: psill, range, nugget

title: Kriging Best Fit: kbfit - Fit variogram models and kriging models to spatial data and select the best model based on the metrics values — kbfit
text: list two elements: all_models best_model

title: Kriging Best Fit: kbfit - Fit variogram models and kriging models to spatial data and select the best model based on the metrics values — kbfit
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Try different initial values for fitting the variogram models initial_values <- list(   list(psill = 1, range = 100000, nugget = 10),   list(psill = 0.5, range = 50000, nugget = 5),   list(psill = 2, range = 150000, nugget = 15) )  # Set some models to fit models <- c("Sph", "Exp", "Gau")  # Select Best: Fit variogram models and kriging models result <- kbfit(response = "response",                 formula = response ~ predictor1 + predictor2,                 data = data_sf,                 models = c("Sph", "Exp", "Gau", "Mat"),                 initial_values = initial_values)  result$all_models result$best_model } # }

Custom ggplot2 theme function — theme_hmsid
text: Custom ggplot2 theme function

title: Custom ggplot2 theme function — theme_hmsid
code: theme_hmsid(   base_size,   text_size,   subtitle_size,   subtitle_margin,   plot_title_size,   plot_title_margin,   ... )

title: Custom ggplot2 theme function — theme_hmsid
text: base_size base font size text_size plot text size subtitle_size, subtitle_margin plot subtitle size margin plot_title_size, plot_title_margin plot title size margin ... arguments passed theme_hmsid

title: Custom ggplot2 theme function — theme_hmsid
text: customized theme ggplot object.

title: Custom ggplot2 theme function — theme_hmsid
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2) dat <- data.frame(   x = seq_along(1:5),   y = rnorm(n = 5, mean = 0.5, sd = 1) ) dat |>   ggplot(aes(x = x, y = y)) +   geom_line() +   theme_hmsid() } # }
